title: 10 Easy Ways To Make Your Home More Energy Efficient

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`As the cost of living continues to rise, it\u2019s more important than ever for Americans to find ways to save money and stay within a budget. After all, no one wants to feel like they\u2019re drowning in bills every month.
To that end, everyone could probably stand to tighten their belts a little bit when it comes to their day-to-day expenses; after all, there are several small things we can do on a daily basis that will collectively add up and help us save money in the long run. In this blog post, we\u2019ll cover everything you need to know about energy efficiency at home and how you can start saving money by making your house more efficient today!`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

content.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...o}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...o,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("h2",null,"How To Make Your Home More Energy Efficient"),mdx("p",null,`The best way to start making your home more energy efficient is by conducting an energy audit. First and foremost, an energy audit is the process of determining which areas of your home are energy inefficient. This information will be used to help you decide which areas of your home require immediate attention when it comes to making it more energy efficient.
A thorough energy audit will also tell you how much money you\u2019re spending each month on energy bills and why you\u2019re spending so much. Armed with this knowledge, you can then decide how you want to go about making your home more energy efficient.`),mdx("h2",null,"Install LED Lighting"),mdx("p",null,`LED lighting is changing the game when it comes to making your home more energy efficient. Simply put, LED lights not only last longer than traditional light bulbs but are also more energy efficient.
A single LED light can last anywhere from 15 to 25 years, and the average LED bulb uses 75% less energy than the average incandescent bulb.
That\u2019s not to say that incandescent bulbs should be completely phased out. There are a few exceptions where they\u2019re better than LED bulbs. The only way to know for sure is to conduct an energy audit of your home.`),mdx("h2",null,"Update Your Appliances"),mdx("p",null,`Appliances that are more than a decade old are costing you money in two ways. First, they\u2019re using more energy than they need to. Second, they\u2019re breaking down more often than they should.
In order to save money on your energy bills while extending the life of your appliances, you should consult a professional to help you select new appliances.
While you may have to spend a little bit of money upfront, the return on investment will be well worth it.`),mdx("h2",null,"Weather-proof Your Home"),mdx("p",null,`If your home has holes that allow outside air to get in, you\u2019re losing money and wasting energy.
Problems like these can be easily identified and solved via an energy audit.
You can also easily fix small holes in your walls (typically caused by pests) by purchasing a can of spray foam.
The best time to weather-proof your home is in the fall, when temperatures are still relatively mild and you\u2019re not as rushed to get things done.`),mdx("h2",null,"Install A Programmable Thermostat"),mdx("p",null,`A programmable thermostat is an easy way to make your home more energy efficient. A programmable thermostat allows you to program your heating and cooling system to turn on or off at a certain time.
When used in conjunction with an energy audit, a programmable thermostat is an excellent way to make your home more energy efficient. If you\u2019re not sure how to install a programmable thermostat, you can hire a professional or refer to the instruction manual.`),mdx("h2",null,"Add Weatherization Basics: Windows And Doors"),mdx("p",null,`Windows and doors are two of the most important areas in your house when it comes to making it more energy efficient. If your windows are old, they\u2019re probably not as energy efficient as they could be.
Ditto for your doors. If you have old doors and windows, you can replace them with new, energy-efficient windows and doors.
If you\u2019re not sure where to start, or if you don\u2019t want to replace them yourself, you can hire a contractor to do the work for you.`),mdx("h2",null,"Add A Smart Thermostat With Climate Control"),mdx("p",null,`An Eco-friendly thermostat like the Ecobee4 or the Nest is an easy way to make your home more energy efficient.
These smart thermostats feature sensors that allow them to keep track of your daily habits and program themselves based on your daily routine.
That way, you don\u2019t have to worry about programming your thermostat manually.
You can also control your thermostat remotely using an app on your phone.`),mdx("h2",null,"Add An Eco-Friendly Roof Coating"),mdx("p",null,`You can extend the life of your roof by adding a roof coating. Specifically, you can add an eco-friendly roof coating that will not only protect your roof but also lower your energy costs.
Why is this important? A roof coating like the Gaco-Shine will not only make your roof last longer but will also lower your energy costs by reflecting the sun\u2019s rays away from your house.
For instance, roof coatings made with silicate minerals can reflect as much as 97% of the sun\u2019s energy away from your roof, thus dramatically lowering your energy costs.`),mdx("h2",null,"Conclusion"),mdx("p",null,`Making your home more energy efficient is not only a smart move but also a necessity. These days, it\u2019s not enough to simply get by. We all need to do more with less.
This is especially true when it comes to energy efficiency. No matter what your income level is, you can make your home more energy efficient.
The good news is that it doesn\u2019t cost a lot of money to do so. By following the tips in this article, you can make your home more energy efficient.`),mdx("p",null,"However, you should also remember that there is no one-size-fits-all solution. Every home is different, and there\u2019s no single solution that will work for everyone."))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Deal with a Partner Who's Always on Their Computer

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`When you enter into a relationship with another person, you\u2019ll naturally want to spend as much time together as possible. It can be super easy to fall into a routine when you\u2019re spending so much time with each other. You go to work, come home, and then retreat to your respective rooms for the rest of the night. And while that routine is totally normal and understandable at this stage in your relationship, it might not be exactly what you\u2019re looking for.
It\u2019s easy to get jealous or resentful if your partner is always on their computer \u2014 but that doesn\u2019t mean that there isn\u2019t a reason for their constant use of it. It could be that they are really passionate about something they\u2019re researching online or maybe they have an online business venture they\u2019ve been working on for a while now. However, if this is causing tension between you two, speak up! They may not even realize how much time they spend on their computer and just how much of an impact it has on your relationship. Here are some ways to deal with a partner who's always on their computer:`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: Adopting a Pet and What to Know about Australian Labradoodles

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Adopting a pet from an animal shelter is a great way to bring love and companionship into your home. It\u2019t also a kind and selfless act, as you are giving another creature a second chance at life. However, adopting a pet can be quite the ordeal. You must first understand the ins and outs of owning pets, choose whether you want to adopt an adult or juvenile animal, narrow down your selection of potential pets by checking their housing requirements, veterinarian references and character traits, and finally interview prospective pets before bringing them home with you.
There are many different types of animals that you can adopt as a pet. Read on to find out more about adopting an Australian labradoodle as your new pet!`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: The Top 10 Most Famous Cats in the World

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`When it comes to internet famous animals, cats by far come out on top. With the rise of social media, cat videos and memes have taken over the internet. There are so many funny cats online that it\u2019s almost ridiculous. These kitty clips have gained a massive following online and catapulted these lovable felines into superstardom.
Cats are a part of Internet Culture in ways that other animals just aren\u2019t. They also have unique features that make them much easier to anthropomorphize and create humorous images with. This has led to an explosion in popularity among cats of all kinds, but especially hilarious ones like Grumpy Cat, Henrietta, and Lil Bub. Now let\u2019s take a look at the Top 10 Famous Cats In The World:`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Why do crazy cat people love their cats so much? Because their cats are hilarious. With their constant sneering and condescending glares, feline friends have a knack for being entertaining in the most ridiculous ways. So, if you need a break from those stressful final exam cram sessions, we've compiled a list of the top 10 funniest cat videos on YouTube. From silly cats to crafty cats and everything in between, these videos will give you some much-needed LOLs.
Cat videos are one of the most popular video niches online today. There are several channels on YouTube that are dedicated only to cat videos and nothing else. In this post we\u2019ll look at some of the best channels that feature nothing but cat content \u2013 be it funny cat vines or cute cat compilations \u2013 as well as some of our favorite individual clips from these creators.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: 5 Ways to Reduce Stress during the Holiday Season
The Top 10 Reasons to Own a Cat

intro.compiledSource: const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,"When you think of cats, you probably picture a feline that\u2019s aloof, independent and not overly affectionate. They are seen as independent creatures that are self-sufficient and don\u2019t need constant interaction from humans to be happy. However, owning a cat is fast becoming one of the most common household pets in the world. Almost a third of all households now own at least one cat, with many seeing them as more than just an independent pet but also a friend.Now let\u2019s get this out of the way: Most people who own cats would tell you they do so because they love them. But why? What is it about these often aloof creatures that prompts so many people to give up their time, attention and money to keep one as a pet? Let's check out these top ten reasons why owning a cat is awesome!"))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Deal with Trust Issues in Relationships

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:t,...e}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...e,components:t,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`When you first start dating someone, trust probably isn\u2019t the biggest issue on your mind. You\u2019re getting to know this person and trying to figure out if there might be a potential future with them or not. However, once you get into a relationship with this person and things get more serious, trust can very quickly become an issue.
Even if you don\u2019t trust someone right away, that doesn\u2019t mean the trust issues don\u2019t come up later on. It may take time for them to make you feel uneasy or distrustful of your partner. But it also could be something that crops up almost immediately \u2013 especially if you meet them in a place like a nightclub, bar or other place where people tend to hookup without much thought as to who they\u2019re hooking up with! This article will offer some tips on how to deal with these trust issues in relationships and help resolve any problems from arising in the first place.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;
